lead_paragraph: On two or three occasions, lately, upon the Railroads of ENGLAND, a car has taken fire, and before the engineer could be notified of the fact, serious injury has been done to property and to life. The English press has been, in consequence, seriously agitating the question--how shall communication be established between the passengers and the conductor? All sorts of suggestions have been made, but none have seemed just the thing.
